alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:59PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Rock Island and west central Henry Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Warner, or near Moline, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Coal Valley around 305 PM CDT. Moline around 315 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Milan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 3 and 9, and between mile markers 12 and 13, and near mile marker 15. Interstate 280 between mile markers 17 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
